results.title: Indigenous Australians : an Aboriginal community focus
results.brief_description: An interactive CDROM from NSW TAFE which is the first to draw on the comprehensive knowledge and expertise of Aboriginal community members and is an invaluable teaching resource. The concept behind the CD ROM is to let members of various Aboriginal communities become teachers of their rich culture. A resource guide accompanies the CD ROM.

results.title: India: two girls one camera
results.creator_credit: Citt Williams, Kylie Washington and Food For Thought
results.brief_description: Two childhood friends capture their thoughts and feelings as they travel to India and encounter a clash between Eastern and Western cultures which varies from the trivial to the tragic.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Citt Williams, Kylie Washington and Food For Thought

results.title: India: A Personal Encounter
results.creator_credit: Michael Dillon and Michael Dillon Film Enterprises
results.brief_description: Sir Edmund Hillary and friends journey from the ocean at India’s southernmost tip to the snows of Himalayas, a pilgrimage similar to those taken by millions of Hindus each year. Travelling by such unconventional means as canal boat, camel, elephant and bullock cart as well as by foot, bicycle, train and an old river sailboat, they were able to see the real India, through the tropical backwaters of Kerala, the deserts of Rajasthan, along the Ganges and into the Himalayas. They saw snake boat races, a heart-stopping martial arts display with flexible swords, a gathering of 10,000 camels, an ancient fort city in the Thar desert and much, much more. A stunningly photographed record of the remarkable sights and experiences of this remarkable journey - an enthralling family adventure.

results.title: Increasing productivity and efficiency: setting the right climate
results.creator_credit: Pare Lorentz Jr and BNA Communications
results.brief_description: Delves into teamwork, what it is and is not, how to institute it, the climate in which it flourishes. Portrays a five-point model for critiquing progress and discusses the line manager’s vital role as a paraprofessional trainer.

results.title: Incontinence: a diarrhetic flow of obvious mismatches
results.creator_credit: Manuel De Landa and De Landa
results.brief_description: Experimental film dealing with film editing and the visual image. Contains seven individual sequences of mismatching dialogue/actors/scenes with all scenes based on actual dialogue from “Who’s afraid of Virginia Woolf?”. However, a comic nightmare takes place and a healthy disregard for the text creates quite a bizarre interpretation of this well-known piece of literature. Cast includes Dina Paisner, Ken Burns, Patrick Gerstle, Susan Schneider and others.

results.title: Incest: the victim nobody believes
results.creator_credit: J. Gary Mitchell and J Gary Mitchell Film Company
results.brief_description: Openly discusses the issues of child sexual abuse and helps make the public aware of the extent of this problem. Points out the impact a childhood incestuous experience can have on a victim’s entire life.

results.title: In your custody
results.brief_description: This staff training film, shows custodial procedures to be followed when transferring prisoners from one place to another by train, plane, and car. It illustrates subterfuges that should be anticipated, and ways in which they may be avoided or foiled.

results.title: In touch with the world
results.creator_credit: John Fletcher, Leon Clore, Basic Films and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: Made in 1964 for the General Post Office in Great Britain this documentary features the employees and their work, such as night postal sorters, a postman on his delivery round, telephone operators, clerical and management staff. The accomplished cinematography by Manny Wynn is complemented by James Harpham’s original music composition.

results.title: In too deep
results.creator_credit: Colin South, John Tatoulis and Media World Productions
results.brief_description: Mack is an anti-social young gangster who plots to hold up a bank. The police and a rival underwold gang are pursuing him because he has an incriminating tape. An encounter with steamy jazz singer Wendy abruptly halts his criminal activites and, throwing caution to the wind, the two embark on a tempestuous relationship which becomes an all consuming obsession. Despite the danger, the two lovers live only for the moment and on the edge of tragedy. Cast includes Hugo Race, Santha Press, Rebekah Elmalogou, John Flaus and Dominic Sweeny.
